vegetable peel.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

fruit peel.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

leftover food.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

rotten vegetables.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

egg shells.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

tea leaves.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

coffee grounds.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

flowers.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

puja flowers.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

garden waste.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

leaves.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

coconut husk.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

bones.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

meat scraps.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

food scraps.instruction: Goes in the GREEN bin. This waste will be composted.

plastic bottle.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Please rinse and dry before disposing.

shampoo bottle.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Please rinse and dry before disposing.

plastic container.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Please rinse and dry before disposing.

plastic bag.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Best to avoid using these altogether.

newspaper.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Keep it dry.

magazine.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Keep it dry.

paper.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Keep it dry.

cardboard.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Flatten the box to save space.

pizza box.instruction: If clean, goes in the BLUE bin. If very oily, tear off oily parts (GREEN bin) and recycle the rest.

glass bottle.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Rinse before disposing.

glass jar.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Rinse before disposing.

metal can.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Rinse before disposing.

aluminium foil.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin if clean. Crumple into a ball.

milk packet.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Rinse and dry it first.

tetrapak.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Flatten to save space.

juice box.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. Flatten to save space.

chips packet.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. This is multi-layered plastic and is hard to recycle.

biscuit packet.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. This is multi-layered plastic and is hard to recycle.

old clothes.instruction: Consider donating first. If unusable, place in the BLUE bin.

thermocol.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. It is not easily recyclable, try to avoid it.

styrofoam.instruction: Goes in the BLUE bin. It is not easily recyclable, try to avoid it.

battery.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins. It contains harmful chemicals. Collect and give to a designated E-Waste collection center.

light bulb.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins, especially CFLs which contain mercury. Collect and give to a designated E-Waste collection center.

tube light.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins, especially CFLs which contain mercury. Collect and give to a designated E-Waste collection center.

cfl.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins as it contains mercury. Collect and give to a designated E-Waste collection center.

mobile phone.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins. Find a local e-waste collection point for safe disposal.

electronics.instruction: DO NOT throw in regular bins. Find a local e-waste collection point for safe disposal.

medicine.instruction: Expired or unused medicines should not be thrown in bins. Return them to a pharmacy for safe disposal.

syringe.instruction: Extremely hazardous. Do not throw in bins. Contact a local clinic or hospital for safe biomedical waste disposal.

sanitary pad.instruction: Wrap securely in newspaper and place in a separate bag before putting in the BLUE bin. Handle with care.

diaper.instruction: Wrap securely and place in a separate bag before putting in the BLUE bin. Handle with care.

paint can.instruction: Do not throw in bins, as it can contaminate soil and water. Check with KMC for hazardous waste collection days.

pesticide bottle.instruction: Do not throw in bins. These are highly toxic. Check with KMC for hazardous waste collection days.

broken glass.instruction: Wrap carefully in thick newspaper and label it "BROKEN GLASS" before placing in the BLUE bin to protect sanitation workers.
